Biochemistry.1: Apply the basic principles of the physical sciences to the study of biological systems to explain how organisms consume and convert energy to enable the processes of life.
Biochemistry.2: Attribute the function and regulation of biomolecules to specific macromolecular structures through the use of quantitative and analytical computational techniques.
Biochemistry.3: Explain the flow of information through biological systems and predict the impact of environmental or biological variables on system output.
Biochemistry.4: Analyze, interpret, critique and communicate data and ideas concerning topics at the forefront of biochemistry.
